intro: Calylophus hartwegii subsp. maccartii, commonly known as the Maccarthy's calylophus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands or rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
